# Copilot Instructions for Caden Mullen Painting Website

## Project Overview
This is a static HTML/CSS/JavaScript website for a professional painting business called "Caden Mullen Painting". The site is optimized for GitHub Pages deployment and focuses on converting visitors into customers.

## Code Style Guidelines
- Use semantic HTML5 elements
- Follow BEM methodology for CSS class naming when adding new components
- Use CSS Grid and Flexbox for layouts
- Maintain mobile-first responsive design approach
- Use vanilla JavaScript (no frameworks)
- Follow accessibility best practices (WCAG 2.1)

## Design Principles
- Professional, clean, and trustworthy appearance
- Color scheme: Primary blue (#2c5aa0), white, and light grays
- Typography: Playfair Display for headings, Roboto for body text
- Smooth animations and hover effects
- Consistent spacing and visual hierarchy

## Business Context
- Target audience: Homeowners and business owners needing painting services
- Primary goal: Generate leads through contact form submissions
- Service area: Central Pennsylvania
- Services: Residential and commercial painting, color consultation, specialty finishes

## Technical Constraints
- Must be compatible with GitHub Pages (static hosting only)
- No server-side processing available
- Optimize for fast loading times
- Ensure cross-browser compatibility
- Mobile-responsive design is crucial

## Content Guidelines
- Professional tone throughout
- Emphasize quality, reliability, and expertise
- Include clear calls-to-action
- Highlight credentials (licensed, insured)
- Use benefit-focused language over feature lists

## When making changes:
- Test responsiveness across different screen sizes
- Maintain consistent branding and color scheme
- Ensure all interactive elements have proper focus states
- Keep the contact form as the primary conversion tool
- Optimize images for web (when real images replace placeholders)
